info.title: Stripe Event API for InfinyOn SDF

account_country.description: The country of the business associated with this invoice, most often the business creating the invoice.

account_name.description: The public name of the business associated with this invoice, most often the business creating the invoice.

amount_due.description: Final amount due for the invoice

amount_shipping.description: The sum of all the shipping amounts

attempt_count.description: Number of payment attempts made for this invoice

attempted.description: Whether an attempt has been made to pay the invoice

created.description: Timestamp when the invoice was created

lines.description: The individual line items that make up the invoice

hosted_invoice_url.description: The URL for the hosted invoice page, which allows customers to view and pay an invoice. If the invoice has not been finalized yet, this will be null.

paid.description: Whether payment was successfully collected for this invoice

paid_out_of_band.description: Whether the invoice was manually marked paid

period_end.description: End of the usage period for this invoice

period_start.description: Start of the usage period for this invoice

subtotal.description: Total before any discounts or taxes are applied

billing_reason.description: Indicates the reason why the invoice was created.

base_invoiceitem.description: Invoice Items represent the component lines of an invoice.

amount.description: Amount (in the `currency` specified) of the invoice item.

customer.description: The ID of the customer who will be billed when this invoice item is billed.

date.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the object.

quantity.description: Quantity of units for the invoice item.

base_invoiceitem.title: InvoiceItem

base_customer.description: This object represents a customer of your business.

delinquent.description: Tracks the most recent state change on any invoice belonging to the customer.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

invoice_prefix.description: The prefix for the customer used to generate unique invoice numbers.

name.description: The customer's full name or business name.

next_invoice_sequence.description: The suffix of the customer's next invoice number (for example, 0001).

base_customer.title: Customer

base_charge.description: The `Charge` object represents a single attempt to move money into your Stripe account.

amount.description: Amount intended to be collected by this payment in

amount_captured.description: Amount in cents captured can be less than the amount attribute on the charge.

amount_refunded.description: Amount in cents refunded can be less than the amount attribute on the charge.

balance_transaction.description: ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this charge.

calculated_statement_descriptor.description: The full statement descriptor that is passed to card networks.

captured.description: If the charge was created without capturing

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

customer.description: ID of the customer this charge is for if one exists.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

disputed.description: Whether the charge has been disputed.

failure_code.description: Error code explaining reason for charge failure if available.

failure_message.description: Message to user further explaining reason for charge failure if available.

invoice.description: ID of the invoice this charge is for if one exists.

paid.description: `true` if the charge succeeded, or was successfully authorized for later capture.

receipt_url.description: This is the URL to view the receipt for this charge.

refunded.description: Whether the charge has been fully refunded. If the charge is only partially refunded, this attribute will still be false.

status.description: The status of the payment is either `succeeded`, `pending`, or `failed`.

base_charge.title: Charge

base_payment_intent.description: A PaymentIntent guides you through the process of collecting a payment from your customer.

amount.description: Amount intended to be collected by this PaymentIntent.

cancellation_reason.description: Reason for cancellation of this PaymentIntent.

capture_method.description: Controls when the funds will be captured from the customer's account.

confirmation_method.description: Confirm this PaymentIntent automatically, or if it requires customer action.

created.description: Time at which the object was created.

customer.description: ID of the Customer this PaymentIntent belongs to, if one exists.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the object.

invoice.description: ID of the invoice that created this PaymentIntent, if it exists.

payment_method_types.description: The list of payment method types this PaymentIntent is allowed to use.

receipt_email.description: Email address that the receipt for the resulting payment will be sent to.

base_payment_intent.title: PaymentIntent

base_payout.description: A `Payout` object is created when you receive funds from Stripe

amount.description: The amount in cents that transfers to your bank account or debit card.

arrival_date.description: Date that you can expect the payout to arrive in the bank.

automatic.description: Returns `true` if the payout is created by an automated payout schedule.

balance_transaction.description: ID of the balance transaction that describes the impact of this payout.

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

failure_code.description: Error code that provides a reason for a payout failure.

failure_message.description: Message that provides the reason for a payout failure, if available.

method.description: The method used to send this payout, which can be `standard` or `instant`

reconciliation_status.description: If `completed`, you can list all balance transactions that are paid out.

source_type.description: The source balance this payout came from: `card`, `fpx`, or `bank_account`.

statement_descriptor.description: Extra information about a payout that displays on the user's bank statement.

status.description: Current status of the payout: `paid`, `pending`, `in_transit`, `canceled` or `failed`.

base_payout.title: Payout

base_subscription_schedule.description: A subscription schedule allows you to create and manage the lifecycle of a subscription

canceled_at.description: Time at which the subscription schedule was canceled. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

completed_at.description: Time at which the subscription schedule was completed. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

customer.description: ID of the customer who owns the subscription schedule.

end_behavior.description: Behavior of the subscription schedule and underlying subscription when it ends.

released_at.description: Time at which the subscription schedule was released. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

status.description: The present status of the subscription schedule.

base_subscription_schedule.title: SubscriptionSchedule

base_issuing_cardholder.description: An object represents an individual or business entity who is issued cards

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

name.description: The cardholder's name. This will be printed on cards issued to them.

status.description: Specifies whether to permit authorizations on this cardholder's cards.

base_issuing_cardholder.title: IssuingCardholder

base_issuing_card.description: You can create physical or virtual cards that are issued to cardholders.

cancellation_reason.description: The reason why the card was canceled.

id.description: The cardholder's unique identifier for the

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

exp_month.description: The expiration month of the card.

exp_year.description: The expiration year of the card.

financial_account.description: The financial account this card is attached to.

last4.description: The last 4 digits of the card number.

status.description: Whether authorizations can be approved on this card.

base_issuing_card.title: IssuingCard

base_issuing_dispute.description: As a card issuer, you can dispute transactions that the cardholder does not agree with.

amount.description: Disputed amount in the card's currency

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

currency.description: The currency the `transaction` was made in.

loss_reason.description: The enum that describes the dispute loss outcome.

reason.description: The reason for filing the dispute. Its value will match the field containing the evidence.

base_issuing_dispute.title: IssuingDispute

base_issuing_authorization.description: When an issued card is used to make a purchase, an Issuing `Authorization` object is created.

amount.description: The total amount that was authorized or rejected.

approved.description: Whether the authorization has been approved.

authorization_method.description: How the card details were provided.

cardholder.description: The cardholder to whom this authorization belongs.

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

merchant_amount.description: The total amount that was authorized or rejected in the `merchant_currency`.

merchant_currency.description: The local currency that was presented to the cardholder for the authorization.

status.description: The current status of the authorization in its lifecycle.

wallet.description: The digital wallet used for this transaction.

base_issuing_authorization.title: IssuingAuthorization

base_topup.description: To top up your Stripe balance, you create a top-up object.

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

description.description: An arbitrary string attached to the object. Often useful for displaying to users.

expected_availability_date.description: Date the funds are expected to arrive in your Stripe account for payouts.

failure_code.description: Error code explaining reason for top-up failure if available.

failure_message.description: Message to user further explaining reason for top-up failure if available.

base_topup.title: Topup

base_source.description: `Source` objects allow you to accept a variety of payment methods.

amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit.

client_secret.description: The client secret of the source. Used for client-side retrieval using a publishable key.

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

customer.description: The ID of the customer to which this source is attached.

base_source.title: Source

dob.description: The date of birth of this cardholder.

first_name.description: The first name of this cardholder.

last_name.description: The last name of this cardholder.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

day.description: The day of birth, between 1 and 31.

month.description: The month of birth, between 1 and 12.

end.description: The end of the period, which must be greater than or equal to the start.

start.description: The start of the period. This value is inclusive.

atm_fee.description: The fee charged by the ATM for the cash withdrawal.

cashback_amount.description: The amount of cash requested by the cardholder.

category.description: A categorization of the seller's type of business.

category_code.description: The merchant category code for the seller’s business

city.description: City where the seller is located

country.description: Country where the seller is located

network_id.description: Identifier assigned to the seller by the card network.

postal_code.description: Postal code where the seller is located

state.description: State where the seller is located

terminal_id.description: An ID assigned by the seller to the location of the sale.

url.description: URL provided by the merchant on a 3DS request
